glossary.definition: A specific, measurable goal set for an employee or team
Key Performance Indicator - a measurable value demonstrating effectiveness
Linking individual objectives to team or organizational objectives
Process of breaking down high-level objectives into lower-level objectives

business_rules: Objectives must be specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART)
Objectives must have defined target and current value
Objectives can be aligned to higher-level objectives (cascading)
KPIs must have measurement method and frequency defined
Objective progress must be updated regularly (typically monthly or quarterly)
Objectives can have dependencies on other objectives
Objective completion requires validation and approval
KPIs are calculated automatically or updated manually based on data sources
Objectives can be shared across team members
calculations_or_formulas: KPI value = measurement calculation based on data source
invariants: Objective target must be greater than current value (for growth objectives)
Objective must have valid owner (employee or team)
KPI measurement method must be defined
Objective alignment must not create circular dependencies
Objective dates must be valid (start <= end)
edge_cases: Objective target is adjusted mid-period - system recalculates progress, maintains history
Objective dependency is not met - system flags dependency, may block dependent objective completion
KPI data source is unavailable - system flags missing data, uses last known value or estimates
Objective is shared across team - system tracks individual contributions, aggregates team progress
Objective alignment creates cycle - system detects cycle, prevents alignment, requires resolution
Objective owner changes - system transfers ownership, maintains history, notifies new owner
Objective is completed early - system marks complete, allows new objective creation
KPI calculation fails - system logs error, uses fallback calculation or manual entry
compliance_requirements: Objective data must be retained for performance history
Objective changes must be logged with reason and approver
KPI calculations must be auditable and traceable
Performance ratings based on objectives must be fair and consistent

inputs: Objective definition (description, target, current value, dates)
KPI definition (measurement method, data source, frequency)

user_journeys: Manager creates objective for employee - defines target, dates, and alignment, objective is active
Employee updates objective progress - updates current value, system recalculates progress percentage
System calculates KPI value - retrieves data from source, calculates value, updates KPI record
Manager aligns objectives - links individual objective to team objective, creates cascade
Objective is completed - employee marks complete, manager validates, objective is closed
System generates objective report - aggregates progress, calculates achievement, shows alignment
acceptance_criteria_suggestions: Given objective creation, when target and dates are defined, then objective is created and tracking begins
Given progress update, when current value is updated, then progress percentage is recalculated and displayed
Given KPI calculation, when data source is available, then KPI value is calculated and updated
Given objective alignment, when objectives are linked, then alignment relationship is created and cascade is established
Given objective completion, when target is reached and validated, then objective is marked complete and achievement is recorded
open_questions: What are the specific objective types? (individual? team? organizational?)
How are KPI values calculated? (automatic from data sources? manual entry? hybrid?)
What is the process for objective adjustments? (mid-period changes? approval required?)
How are objective dependencies handled? (blocking? non-blocking? warnings?)
What is the objective update frequency? (monthly? quarterly? on-demand?)
How are shared objectives tracked? (individual contributions? team aggregate?)
assumptions: Objectives follow SMART criteria (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound)
KPIs can be calculated automatically from data sources or updated manually
Objective progress is updated regularly throughout the period
Objective achievement affects overall performance ratings
